itMGr5wqiMfl9WHGTgTkuA.text: The new Chipotle location is great!!! The best part is that it has decreased the line length at both East End locations. The employes are friendly and very generous with the portions.  I hope they create an outside area for the summer similar to Baum. The sidewalk is quite large so it has possibilities.

6aYC6o3kSFGX9guwVVHAMA.text: First of all love the food. The service is as good as it's gonna get.  Chipotle is virtually busy all the time. I only had one semi-bad experience here, and that was when the woman gave me guac on my bowl and I didn't ask for it. But hey that's nothing to complain about.

cQFoWnrl9dvdX2XqvcYoeg.text: Solid average in terms of food. You will get exactly what you want from this place. It might not be in a normal time frame. Do not worry, it will eventually come. I wish I had the job of the person who bags the food and turns around to grab a bag of chips. That seems like such a bomb a$$ job. I had a lot of time to watch the lucky girl who was assigned that job today. Every time I come in the line is to the door. One would think it's because of the quality of the food, sadly that is not the reason. They're just always so slow, all of their employees. My love of chipotle food always wins over my hatred of waiting in the long, slow line that always comes with eating at this location. Full disclosure, I will be eating here again soon, once I block a portion of my day off.

ypOQTmZRAvW1AFRY-Vpxbg.text: first time   but defiantly not the last... one of the better somewhat fast food I have had in a while as it was relatively healthy.  the line was long but it went by fast.. the employees knew how to get you in and get you out but were not pushing you thru the line... can't wait to go again...

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - East Liberty, PA, United States

9-Z14qw78bGbfPCUjWs3hg.text: Love Chipotle, but this is by far the slowest one I've ever been to on multiple occasions. Management, get a clue.

clBG3puGILezYY06hRT3Bw.text: I'm a serious Chipotle-lover. I don't know what it is about their burritos and bowls (relatively simple items), but it's addicting. This new location is no exception. They have been very fast and pleasant in my experiences so far. It's about a mile closer to than the Baum location which I previously frequented, so that's also a plus.

E-Uz2R72wbD16wnKAc7-dA.text: I'm sorry, but I think Chipotle is vastly overrated. I know I may be in the minority here,but I simply think their food is average. The burritos are good, but not worth the price- and it still irks me to the core that getting guac on your dish costs so much extra. Yes, I'll continue to stop by there once in a while- but I don't know what all of the fuss is about.

1DwBiGCmOWHA7bVWCFD_mQ.text: Slow! 15 people in line and ONE server! Lame! This place is the worst when it comes to efficiency. They need to be retained. Customer service is fine. But what can you do when your customer has waited in line for up to 45 minutes! Owners of this franchise don't seem to care.

krIVV5Zh8Fu3dtwAbomoIA.text: I love Chipotle, but I do not love this location. The service is the worst of any location I've ever been to. Each time I've been here, I've waited in line more than 15 minutes, regardless of how many people are in front of me. They skimp pretty badly on all of ingredients so that you constantly have to ask for more than a tablespoon of something. Such a letdown because we need a good lunch option in Shadyside, but I would stick to the Baum location from now on.

IJkzW7TMxV_7bgc5wItnFA.text: I am not one to complain at all and I am usually a very polite customer. However, this Chipotle Mexican Grill is so awful with the most horrible customer service that I could give it less than a star and no stars at all, I could! I had to call and order and I was told they do not accept orders over the phone. They only accept orders placed online. Not everyone has access to the Internet! What kind of idiotic thing is that for customer service?! How could you not accept phone orders? This isn't grubhub or Uber where you only do things online from a smartphone. I am disgusted by the customer service at this location and the owner needs to do something about this! These lazy people don't want to work or help out a customer. They act like they don't care. When I asked if I could still call back to ask a question about an order status, the guy on the phone seriously said: "You don't have to. It tells you online." It's implying that they don't want to be bothered. Please don't go here if you expect customer service and professionalism! Absolutely pathetic how they deal with customers and I am very disappointed.

DjTJ48gCajc9DD1MJvEYrg.text: This location seems to have the freshest food! The manager and staff are also very friendly.

1FmX6YuJoMTbHlE_y4uVtg.text: If this place wasn't in the perfect location it would have already gone under. It's Chipotle, yes, but of the three in the area (the others are on Baum Blvd and Forbes Avenue in Oakland) this one is the worst. You could go to a nice restaurant and finish your meal by the time you are served at this Chipotle. No one is sitting in the restaurant eating other than employees who are on break because it takes so long to serve each customer.

92MbhtEYGUCWJlDnDzpyhA.text: This chipotle is brutal when there are more than 5 people in line. The workers need to be retrained to move a little more quickly. Also, way too often the chicken is overlooked and you end up getting black crunchy pieces in your dish. This is very unpleasant and tastes horrible. The people are very nice and overall the food is delicious but a lack of training is evident.

DghVE4KcnwZTTSt510u2kA.text: The new location is great, with an awesome set up inside. However, if you're looking for an quick and easy Chipotle experience I suggest the Baum location. My completely reasonable burrito took far too long to wrap and ended up being a quarter of the size of a typical burrito, for the same price. The ingredient ratios were terrible-- my burrito was basically all rice-- and I noticed customers before me letting the staff know that their burritos were not ideal. "This is okay for me, but you can't wrap other peoples' burritos like this," said one. Leniency is deserved, the employees are all new, but there should be at least one person there with experience.

PXbMBCEFkY2lmYi0ztZuWA.text: I love chipotle I will pick it over any and everything anytime. But this particular location is not the place I'd go to. The staff is always friendly so it's not them it the service from them. But management during the evening shift is rude, instead of informing you that there is a fresh batch of ingredients coming she will putt the tail end of everything in your bowl that you pay for. My bowl is literally nothing but bean juice, a spoon of rice and of course to balance it I had it minimize the portions of everything else defeating the purpose. My mom ordered two bowls and requested a tortilla on the side of both of them. The manager barely heated them they are gummy and she threw them at the line worker as if she was irritated she had to do it. You could see her displeasure having to do work. This is a location I will not go back to.

eP17url5pNiPl3OJHC7jnA.text: I love this place... What do they put in this FOOD!!! Lol lovvveeeeeeee I'm goin back 2morrow

TYX6KdnuLZwwWB-FcEzaXw.text: I will start by saying I love Chipotle. I do. I love the ungodly giant burritos you can get and I love the option for a salad. This place is constantly packed, which is really annoying if all you want to do is slide on in for a quick meal to eat in or take it to go. I know there's an option to call in ahead of time (I think), but I seem to forget to ever do that because I come here on a whim. While I do enjoy the food, I've been frustrated with the service. It seems there's always one, maybe two, people trying to help customers while other people are talking or doing something in the back. I understand there are other things that have to get done, but if it's so busy...maybe try to hustle versus texting? This is what I've witnessed and can't say it happens every single time.  After waiting in line a few times, I get up front to ask for a salad and have to keep asking for lettuce and some veggies as my to go order is being passed down the line. Same with the dressing for the salad. If I didn't keep asking, I'm pretty sure it would have been forgotten. I like the simplicity of the menu even though some people come up the line thinking they can ask for some weird concoction they don't even put together. Aside from my issues with slower service, I will say I've always encountered a pleasant employee. They're either smiling or say hello and I think that makes a huge difference. I understand they get slammed and a lot of the time they're trying to keep up with everything. I think once or twice I was able to get to Chipotle without a huge line and I felt like I just unlocked some sort of achievement in my life. Yes, it was that big of a deal.

8bUE49lBpikk_ssKue-HMQ.text: Tasty and cheap  My favorite is chicken bowl with guacamole and hot&sour sauce.  It would conquer the fast-food market. Watch out, MacDonald haha:D

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - East Liberty, PA, United States

FjWqGaMRjMRoqufTWsuVEg.text: Compared to all closer Chipotle locations (Oakland, Bloomfield) this is the best one in terms of flavor and quantity.  The others really skimp on everything leaving your burrito bowl half empty or even leaving everything really bland.  So I definitely count on this Chipotle for my flavorful fast food needs.  The staff is also always ridiculously friendly.  With them being so busy, I wonder how they even find the time to be so friendly, but they always find a way.

9SD6TO67LGnvhOg5PemJRw.text: I really live Chipottle! It's cheap and nice food. The service is good too. I just think they could have more options for snakes, cause I don't like that chips.

vU7108Bbr1sDPrWTu2HnJw.text: Okay i love chipotle as much as the next person however I just stopped by on my break just now and there was a small line of people in front of me and some starting to form behind me, not very busy there were four employees huddled by the cash register and one gentleman taking care of the first person in line while the rest of us waited, no urgency at all. Second complaint, if I'm going to pay $2 extra for guac don't pick up the spoon and then scrap it off the side and give me a little quarter size amount like you're about to run out. Not a good experience for a slow Thursday

5ZHlqc66l6TdJvm04ECHYw.text: We have a teenage relationship of one of us hanging up the phone and then either/or waiting by the lockers to apologize the next day.    I order the salad to dissuade the guilt of how frequently I partake.  Salad, beans, double chicken, pico, hot sauce = happy tummy.  They are pretty skimp on the protein for the cost. I order double and get what should be the regular portion.  Then again...maybe my idea of a normal portion is jacked. TBD

0PYFHt1ndU-p0ZSX37YheA.text: I'm pretty regular at this Chipotle location. A few employees recognize us immediately, and they always treat us with respect and chat us up. It's a good time coming here. I don't know what it is about Chipotle, but I love my veggie burrito. It's one of the best things I have ever had, and before you judge, know that my diet is limited because of digestive problems. Chipotle burritos have carbs with non-irritating ingredients that fill me up, so I indulge.   I never have any trouble getting a little extra fajita veggies and sour cream. They make my burrito with a perfect balance, and they are always rolled to perfection. A burrito that isn't rolled properly puts me in a very cranky and frustrated mood, and these guys do such a great job.   The staff here is phenomenal, I am always attended to and I think that they move their lines pretty quickly. Chipotle will always be packed. Either you can get dedicated employees who pay attention to the customer and the food, or you can get employees who just pay attention to the food. I know what I would choose.   This team deserves a giant gold star. I can't say enough good things.

MyKnJjPSvSm1vRymC32OpA.text: Ahh I really hate to do this but I don't, I have eaten at chipotle since 2007.   I ordered a salad here, and the chefs and staff are getting this business model from food prep to cooking all wrong.  Resulting in some huge insults to my taste buds. I ordered a salad here with carnitas last Friday. The server girl notices the lettuce in container is lacking she scoops a sparse handful, then yells for more lettuce. I think great she's putting more in, my salad bowl wasn't even bedded with lettuce, nope nothing.   I know I should've said something here but I'm way too tired to care so I don't, next comes a huge scoop of pork carnitas cool I'm down with that. Then my guacamole which actually  somehow more guacamole ends up in my bowl then lettuce. I don't figure this out till later.  The result once I blend my salad with fork is a ooey gooey non crispy mess. I take a bite....  Whoa chef were you salting the carnitas for a Mayflower voyage? Because all I tastE is salt city.   Ok someone's over salting the pork, as I move on I find someone's over salting the guacamole too and alas that's the main flavor of my dish.  Then ewww the texture... Is more soupy then salad. Just all wrong guys so wrong.  I want to come back here but if I do I'll be that annoying bossy person when I order because if these folks can't make a salad it's likely a burrito will short circuit some brainwaves.

gQydezBtdiMnxhFkEsRqWA.text: I went into Chipotle for a quick bite to eat after landing in Pittsburgh and sitting through traffic.  I went to Chipotle because I knew what to expect when walking into the door but I found something completely different as a nice surprise.  When I walked in they were fortunately not busy at all with a staff that was overwhelmingly kind (Not in a bad way, just unexpected).  I placed my order to-go and found myself talking to the cashier for a few minutes due to her inviting conversation and attitude.  Kudos to you guys in Chipotle I'll be sure to visit again if I make my way back to Pittsburgh!

anK1Xf9q8Sbfb9qtMKV-iw.text: Yes, its a non-local fast food chain. I don't care. It serves a purpose and it does a great job at it. Up until this opened, the only place to grab food in under 30 minutes in the neighborhood was McDonalds or Pizza Sola.  Chipotle, you're barely able to be called Mexican, but I still love you.

Swgj1s2jSmdAEZ_QnjXSJw.text: Yeah, the lowly black bean, high in fiber, tasty, and, it doesn't cause as much digestive discomfort as some beans. But, I don't understand the extreme fascination people have with Chipotle. It's a burrito, and not a very good one at that. What made my burrito good was the half bottle of hot sauce I shook on it. The Chipotle idea is great, make your burrito as healthy or unhealthy as you want. I had brown rice, beans, and veggies on a whole wheat wrap. I mean it was okay, nothing I couldn't do at home. and with a drink almost 9 bucks. I can make a dozen at home for that price, rice is cheap, a pepper, some onions, a can of black beans, and who doesn't have a bottle or two of hot sauce in their fridge?   I'm not a huge fan, but I don't hate it.

_ThbdTUPGP5gjHR0n0ummw.text: So glad this location opened. The Baum one is always packed to the gills and service has gone waaaay down.  This location is having expected we just opened issues- ie they will ask you 4 times at the register if you want a drink and there may not be any chicken when you go but everyone is nice and they pulled a few of my favorite employees from Baum to this one so that's cool. I should add any time there is a meat that is freshly cooked I wait for it if I have time. It's always extra delicious.  Bummed they only have the uncomfortable tables and no booths but you can't win them all.

AP9bjvMXWgX1zXuQevTQsg.text: I was excited to visit this location on its opening day! There are a decent amount of tables inside and a lot of bar seating as well. The interior was spotless and the staff was incredibly friendly.  I ordered my usual bowl to go, and everything appeared to be fresh and clean in the serving area as well. Portions seemed a little scant compared to the Baum Blvd location, but I certainly don't need a super-sized bowl, so I didn't mind.  For their first day, the staff seemed quick and efficient, and really welcoming as well. I look forward to walking quite often.   The only downside is the parking situation. This parking lot was a mess before Chipotle. Now it will be much worse. Park as close to Dinette as possible and away from the wine store, unless you park in the excess parking area near MCN Salon. People coming up the ramp from Whole Foods whip around so fast that it's almost impossible to see clearly when trying to back out of a spot near the wine store. Otherwise, love this Chipotle!

9T6oqNBm6U-CSNLiTDUuAA.text: You would think that chipotle would be attentive to customers given their recent e coli snafu, but not chipotle shadyside. When I go there at 11 when they're supposed to open and watch one of their workers eat a burrito, come out to smoke a cigarette and go back inside without any sign of opening by 1115 w an amassing line of customes, I guess I would have to disagree. Frustrating. Oh well, at least it reminded us that we'd be much happier down the road at mad Mex.

ZNHBjAu1RWoDheAtx19uiQ.text: I've always preferred Qdoba myself, but Chipotle food is pretty good. This location is always PACKED it seems, like literally lines all the way to the door whenever I've visited. But service is relatively quick and the quality has always been good. I do think the prices are on the high side considering your food doesn't come with a side or a drink.  I'm disappointed though as on my last trip I needed to change my daughter, went into the restroom to find there is no changing table inside. They have a kids' menu, they have highchairs, but no changing table? I don't get that.

_IiMxb5AUsoPRIIaZ0tPoA.text: I am glad this is here and it's very closed to me I am like five mins away. They have great food at great prices. I love the chicken burritos and root beer for my drink. This is a great addition for the African American community of east liberty. Also needs more people from this area to work here. Long live east liberty!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - East Liberty, PA, United States. Great stuff they have!!

KmKEDEVqS8jugmF9xFU0Vg.text: This is one of the better Chipotle restaurants in the Pittsburgh area for those who must eat gluten free. The staff is very knowledgeable about allergens and the causes of cross-contamination. On top of this they are incredibly friendly and eager to please.

-CqMcmBwVAJZj7n71yYwiw.text: There's a pretty large parking lot at this location so you'll always fine a place to park. However, this place is always packed and understaffed. The line is always backed up because service is so slow! Be prepared to wait a while during lunch and dinner hours. This Chipotle location is also pretty stingy about their portions too. Ask for extra of everything when you can!  TIP: If you don't want to waste your time waiting you can order online and skip the line. Just go to the cashier to pickup your order.   I would recommend going to the Chipotle on Baum. The service is MUCH faster.

7bt5iJGfxgEjAIp_DcYHFQ.text: I love Chipotle because in a pinch you can choose a quick and tasty healthy meal if you pick carefully. They are vegetarian friendly as well....some real tasty options.  This location is an easy in, easy out. There can be a short wait for a parking space depending on time of day. The staff is friendly and, like other locations, they are fast!  Really, what more is there to say...veggie bowl please!

xThwBTdXrgQ2OTl4w4SzoQ.text: I'm a big fan of Chipotle but I have to say this probably my least favorite location I've been to.. They were low on black beans so they used a very light hand when scooping me some. They were completely out of red onions and peppers (a new batch was on the grill but would've taken another 5 minutes wait). This seems to be a reoccurring problem at this location if you glance at the other reviews.   When eating my meal I did notice the food seemed greasier than usual for Chipotle. Maybe they used a heavy hand with the oil while cooking the food? I just thought this was something worth mentioning.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - East Liberty, PA, United States. Burrito Bowl with Chicken

aqnxV2P3mh-BxqzUKVtVBg.text: Wow. Horrible customer service. I felt like I was at a shitty house party, and not at a well-known dining establishment.. First these two women behind the counter starting arguing about who should go first with the scooping.. which I personally had to call them out and put and end to. Def not my job. Then I asked for lemons and dressing.. she hand las me lemons and says "and what?" I said dressing.. she barely asks down the line for it, which I am fully aware that no one heard.. then I walk down the line myself and ask out loud for it, however no one was paying attention because they were having a 5 minute conversation about another customers bright ass yellow nails. I go back to the register, and loudly say "yo, can I please have some dressing!?"..  Finally I got it.  Terrible.

dyzwX42jBIPrqj_hWAZE5g.text: I would give them more stars if they weren't always running out of everything.  No matter the time of day. It's as if they are never prepared.... ever!  Please do better management.

bMdRuvjcFKxCTyaUW60Rzw.text: The restaurant had paper and food on the floors and the staff was disorganized. People shuffling in the back of the counter weren't working except for 2 young girls. They were out of black beans and sour cream and we're running short other containers so smallest Chipotle burrito ever. After running at the park was very hungry and chose to add chips too. Yah ate one in the car on the way home and WOW so stale. Very sad Chipotle location. Only reason I paid for 38.00 of food is because I was starving, it was 8 pm, and was too tired to go elsewhere. Hopefully the skimpy burrito doesn't cause any post eat issues.

IFOMHX51hlmTx-d4XJJMZw.text: One of the most Shady Chipottle I visted ever!  they ran out of food and after 35 mint of wait all worker are laughing like monkeys watching everywhere, really pissed!

jtB6LKnFq3-t8zFca4yswA.text: don't ever, ever go to this place. they had no burritos left no guacamole or no steak, and yet they wouldn't give me a chips for free, fools.

EeD4elH_D2gSSfWEP8Jhag.text: The amount of calories in these babies are insane! It is a very extreme amount of food, so I ordered the tacos. They have a variety of different ways you can put your food together. It never seems like 100% trustable produce though. There is a surprising amount of variation for a fast food restaurant, and it is never particularly fast.   I got soft tacos with brown rice, black beans, fajita vegetables, sofritas, guac, lettuce and a drizzle of sour cream. They put very little rice and beans on it, about 2 slivers of pepper, but drenched it in sofritas. Of course with my luck they were spicy and had no warning of such. The meal was good and filling. I don't come here often and I probably won't come back for a while. It's not the best taco/burrito place in Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - East Liberty, PA, United States. Sofritas soft tacos

uYZYqozba5U2_q9n41fBFg.text: I love Chipotle. But this location has let me down every time I go. Slow staff, no one cares about the customers waiting (their texts are more important). Today the place was a disaster. Garbage everywhere, nothing stocked at the beverage station. I just wanted to pay and leave but it took 2 people to bag an online order and the other staff keeps their back towards you. Some new management is needed here.

wQb28ExlgGXHiGLw2vcCOA.text: TERRIBLE chipotle  Terrible service  Tried twice both times terrible experience  Loud disrespectful and ghetto

6ybh5dwiv7GhoRTKS_th_g.text: This Chipotle is by far the worst in town. Chicken is always very dry and burnt, scoops of food are nothing compared to other Chipotle's. Taste isn't the same.

FdGuNIDLObThj_TxvOFbVw.text: Just like any other Chipotle. The place is clean and the food is great! The best part is the staff won't rush you to pick your choice and they are also reasonable with the quantities. They have parking right infront of the store which makes it even attractive to grab a quick lunch or dinner.

gZ2M4XzsHnoMlX340dK3nQ.text: This place, at any given time, not just meal times, is a mess.  There is always a line and it is usually to the door and maybe even then some.  Ordering ahead usually does no good here as pick up times are usually well pass the time you want your food.  Even though this looks like a disaster area from the outside and most definitely when you are inside, the staff still seem to have a happy disposition.  Nothing seems to throw them off.    The food was standard here, nothing out of the ordinary, however the day I was here they were completely out of steak.  Would have been nice to have had that heads up prior to showing up here, even a note on the door would have helped.  I had to think on my toes here and not hold up the line as I was here to pick up food for coworkers and myself.

QbEoGKQ4BVOsPzyFwOphzA.text: Their food tastes fine but their online ordering is inaccurate. I did online ordering, and my husband went to pick up my order. When I opened it at home, even though I did not order any sour cream, there was a ton of sour cream on top. I don't eat sour cream so couldn't eat the food. I called and was told I could bring back my receipt and the food to get a replacement but at that point, my husband didn't want to go back out in the cold. I wanted them to provide an apology and a refund instead. Lesson learned is to open up all orders in store before heading home.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - East Liberty, PA, United States

kKAmqUc4mizAzNaw2UQxKw.text: I was that annoying customer that stopped by 10 minutes to close. Service too a bit longer than usual since I was apart of the closing rush. However slow for Chipotle is still pretty freaking fast. Despite it being the end of the night, everything was hot and fresh. Left a happy trooper!

eMNsdIaPpNGkinjGCIaDHQ.text: Love Chipotle. The bowl (burrito bowl) is my favorite. The staff is friendly, food is fresh and prices are affordable. The only reason I love the NYC Chipotle restaurants is because they serve margaritas. Nothing like a patron margarita to wash your food down.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - East Liberty, PA, United States

vqiMc__ZPJtrilusUBuvHw.text: This Chipotle just opened in February 2014 and is a nice addition to the new developments in the East Liberty neighborhood.   Burritos and Tacos. Does one need to say more? The menu is simple - tasty lime or brown rice, beans, freshly grilled meat (chicken, steak, barbacoa, carnitas), mild/medium/hot salsa, sour cream and cheese, lettuce, and guacamole. My burrito was great and actually better (not overloaded, right size) than in other Pittsburgh Chipotle locations.  If you decide to eat in you'll find yourself on long tables (perfect for groups) or elevated bar tables and chairs. Nice but simple interior, with lots of natural light coming in. I like this store and will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - East Liberty, PA, United States. Chipotle Steak Burrito, &#34;opened&#34;
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - East Liberty, PA, United States. Chipotle Mexican Grill East Liberty
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - East Liberty, PA, United States. Chipotle Steak Burrito, unopened

7cKnVvE2zqdfcLGt48tPew.text: It's not often that I have to stop somewhere for fast food but when I do I try to make it healthy. I like that chipotle has healthy options in general and you can make them even healthier by omitting a lot of stuff. So there's my review on the food.   This location in particular has to have the most miserable staff I have ever encountered at a fast food restaurant.   I've never actually been yelled at before By somebody who is making my food let alone the first two people on the assembly line.   The owners of this franchise need to do something about the staff because the lady beside me who was served also said to me "wow these guys are super unhappy".  I visited on a Monday shortly before 2 PM. With the exception of the super peppy shorter girl at the check out all the other women there were absolutely miserable borderline aggressive,mean and intimidating.

7sKfB0hQosB147sij40e-g.text: I've been to many Chipotles in my lifetime, and it has never failed me once. The best tasting food you will ever find. If I was trapped on a deserted island and could only bring one item with me for survival, it would be a Chipotle burrito bowl.

cEweXhEYS2eYMGN65kSgiw.text: I wish this new location had opened while I was still living in Shadyside! Darn it! Its so close to my old residence that I would've been eating there at least three days a week! Oh well! At least it's close to work!   Chipotle has an app you can use to order your food and I tried it out for the first time! It's pretty easy to use and almost everything  on Chipotles menu is on there (I didn't see corn though). The app gives you the option to pay for your food with a credit/debit card or pay when you pick up.   You can also choose the time you plan to pick up your food. When I arrived I had no issues walking up to the cash register and requesting my pre-ordered meal. Then again, there were not a lot of people in line to begin with but it was still crowded in the dining area.   Chipotle is one of my favorite places but I've never liked going to the Baum location due to the lack of parking and the traffic. I'm glad this new location is open and with the Chipotle app it makes ordering more convenient! Yay!

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - East Liberty, PA, United States. Steak burrito bowl!
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - East Liberty, PA, United States. My steak salad!  :09
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - East Liberty, PA, United States. Storefront!
